nl.tno.stormcv.util

Class StreamReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xuggle.mediatool.AMediaListenerMixin
      • com.xuggle.mediatool.MediaListenerAdapter
        • nl.tno.stormcv.util.StreamReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.xuggle.mediatool.IMediaListener, Runnable

    public class StreamReader
extends com.xuggle.mediatool.MediaListenerAdapter
implements Runnable
    This class reads a video stream or file, decodes frames and puts those in a queue for further processing. The StreamReader will automatically throttle itself based on the size of the queue it writes the frames to. This is done to avoid memory overload if production of frames is higher than the consumption. The actual decoding of frames is done by Xuggler which in turn uses FFMPEG (xuggler jar file is shipped with ffmpeg binaries).
    Author:
    Corne Versloot
